newsitem.title: SYRIA: Syria said backing Palestinian fight against Israel.
newsitem.headline: Syria said backing Palestinian fight against Israel.

text.p: Syria's Parliament Speaker Abdel-Qader Qaddourah met a radical Palestinian guerrilla chief on Tuesday and voiced support to the Palestinian "struggle" against Israel, a Palestinian spokesman said.

Maher al-Taher, spokesman of the Marxist Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine (PFLP), said Qaddourah and PFLP's leader George Habash discussed the Israeli government's settlement policy and the building of a new Jewish settlement in Arab East Jerusalem.
"Mr. Qaddourah stressed during the meeting with comrade Habash Syria's support to the struggle of the Palestinian people against Israel," Taher said.
The PFLP spokesman said Habash expressed during the meeting "satisfaction over Syria's political position which is sticking firmly to the Arab rights".
In a separate statement, Taher also welcomed a resolution adopted by the Arab League on Monday which recommends that Arab states put an end to normal ties with Israel and restore economic boycott.
The PFLP, which strongly opposes the peace deal between Israel and the Palestinians, claimed several attacks in which several Israelis were killed or wounded since 1993 when the accord was signed.
